prompts.title: Stress Inventory
prompts.question: List every source of stress you are currently carrying. Large and small, name them all.
prompts.guidance: Making the invisible visible is the first step. Seneca said: 'It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a great deal of it' on unnamed worries.
prompts.detailedGuidance:

1. Name the stressors: List everything weighing on you right now‚Äîbig and small. Don't rank them yet, just get them out of your head and onto the page.

2. Answer the prompt in detail: Write at least one full paragraph addressing the question. Include specific situations, people, and timelines.

3. Sort by control: Draw a mental line. Which elements can you influence today? Which are beyond your power? Write each in its category.

4. Identify one pattern: Look at what you wrote. Is there a recurring theme (overcommitment, people-pleasing, fear of failure)? Name it in one sentence.

5. Design one micro-relief: Choose a single action you can take today to reduce pressure by even 5%. Make it specific: what, when, and for how long.
